text: José Eusebio Otálora Martínez was a Colombian statesman and General who became President of the United States of Colombia in 1882 in his capacity as the Second Presidential Designate following the death of President Francisco Javier Zaldúa, and the non-acceptance of the office by the First Designate Rafael Núñez.Arismendi Posada, Ignacio; Gobernantes Colombianos; trans. Colombian Presidents; Interprint Editors Ltd., Italgraf, Segunda Edición; Page 121; Bogotá, Colombia; 1983 == Biographic data == Otálora was born in Fomeque, Cundinamarca, on September 16, 1826, and died from a heart attack in Tocaima, Cundinamarca, on April 1, 1884.Jose Eusebio Otalora. BiografiasYVidas.com. Accessed March 24, 2012. He was the second Colombia to die office. ==References== Category:1826 births Category:1885 deaths Category:Colombian diplomats Category:Colombian educators Category:Colombian governors Category:Colombian generals Category:Colombian people of Basque descent Category:Colombian people of Spanish descent Category:Colombian Liberal Party politicians Category:Presidents of Colombia Category:Presidential Designates of Colombia Category:Colombian lawyers
title: José Eusebio Otalora
